stream_context.summary: Kaze streamed from the basement of his newly-bought house and focused almost entirely on Course 11, an abandoned power-plant level. He first showed a large performance gain achieved since the previous stream, then live-designed and programmed the level’s new “weight-scale” platforms, discussed visual style, and touched on a few other updates (new star model, block boss tweaks).

development_findings.summary: Coins were converted from billboards to screen-space rectangles (sprites), giving a 10–15 % performance boost; Bunny Brushworks rose from ~42 FPS to ~47 FPS and most of the power-plant areas now hover near 60 FPS.
development_findings.quote: We found like a 10-15 % performance improvement. At this stage, that is crazy.

development_findings.summary: Further performance work is planned when the team eventually implements the F3DX3 microcode.
A fully textured opaque star model replaced vanilla Mario 64’s transparent placeholder.
The rainbow oil ‘Block Boss’ now has a custom hit effect and additional coins to aid speed-strats; Kaze agrees with Biobak’s suggestion to move soap refill points to the outer grills.
Course 11 layout is locked in: five rooms introducing (1) weight-scale platforms, (2) treadmills, (3) collapsing grates, (4) an electric-hazard slide, and (5) a final multi-mechanic star arena.

Dangling platforms were redesigned live—at Biobak’s prompt—into two-way weight scales whose velocities always sum to zero. Kaze wrote a shared-variable physics system with friction, inertia, and ground-pound acceleration.
development_findings.quote: I think Biobak's idea of simply repurposing this whole thing actually works better.

development_findings.summary: Each treadmill will be an object with a per-instance scrolling-speed parameter so designers can create momentum tricks.

Kaze wants grimy, less-grainy factory textures; reference images were shared. Indoor culling allows up to ~30–40 k polygons for the level. Vertex lighting and sparking electricity are planned for atmosphere.
New material-specific SFX by Yoshi Milkman (e.g., metal grate footsteps) are in production to heighten immersion.
Upcoming level roadmap: Course 12 will be a Wild-West theme; Courses 13–15 remain undecided.

context_findings.summary: Kaze now has a full-time day job, drastically limiting dev hours and preventing any promised release date.
context_findings.quote: I have a full-time job, I can't dedicate that much time to just working on this. It's done when it's done.

context_findings.summary: He recently moved to a house in Canada; streams from the basement (‘dungeon’) where Zeina has ‘banished’ him.
context_findings.quote: Zeina has banished me here. She said I'm not allowed to come up unless it's to grab food.

context_findings.summary: Personal philosophy: extreme frugality—only spends on items that appreciate; claims he has ‘always lived like a poor person’.
context_findings.quote: I have literally not been spending a single cent on stuff that is not worth more money in the future.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is experiencing neck pain after workouts and long streams, calling attention to ageing and ergonomics.
He prefers intrinsic gameplay rewards (‘cool concepts’) over collect-a-thon numbers, criticizing Odyssey’s moon economy.
context_findings.quote: I want the game that rewards me with finding cool shit, not extrinsic motivation like, oh, number go up.

biobak.summary: Suggested converting dangling platforms into counter-weight scales, a mechanic Kaze immediately adopted for Course 11.
biobak.quote: What about the weight system? Standing on one moves the other one up.

biobak.summary: Will handle texture pass for the power-plant; Kaze defers visual choices to him.
biobak.quote: I'll leave the textures to Biobak but I will pick something for now that doesn't look completely awful.

biobak.summary: Agreed that soap refill should attach to outer grills in Block Boss fight.

zeina.summary: Playful dynamic: she ‘banished’ Kaze to the basement studio, limiting upstairs access to food breaks.

key_stories.title: Sprite Coins Boost the Frame-Rate
key_stories.summary: Massive slow-downs plagued early builds. By re-imagining coins as screen-space sprites instead of billboards, Kaze squeezed out an unexpected double-digit FPS gain that brings most areas close to 60 FPS.
key_stories.challenge: CPU and RDP were over-taxed rendering many billboarded coins, capping levels around low-40 FPS.
key_stories.process: Kaze re-implemented coin rendering to draw them as 2-D rectangles in screen space, eliminating costly transformations.
key_stories.outcome: Bunny Brushworks jumped from 42 → 47 FPS (with debugger) and the power-plant now runs nearly full-speed, an improvement Kaze calls ‘crazy’.
key_stories.key_quote: We found like a 10-15 % performance improvement. I don't think we will ever see another performance improvement this big until we implement F3DX3.

key_stories.title: Birth of the Weight-Scale Platform
key_stories.summary: During live block-out of the power-plant, dangling platforms felt derivative. Biobak proposed turning them into linked scales. Kaze instantly rewrote the object logic, producing a fresh mechanic that now anchors Course 11’s design.
key_stories.challenge: Needed a unique introductory platform type for Room 1; dangling swings felt over-used.
key_stories.process: Chat (Biobak) suggested a two-way scale. Kaze scrapped the swing code, added shared-velocity math, friction, and ground-pound interactions, testing until it ‘felt right’.
key_stories.outcome: A new mechanic that introduces physics puzzles and momentum tricks; course layout updated to highlight it.
key_stories.key_quote: I think Biobak's idea of simply repurposing this whole thing actually works better.

key_stories.title: The Unionized Bowser Minions Gag
key_stories.summary: Kaze and chat riffed on an in-game joke: after a strike, Bowser’s minions form a union and negotiate absurdly tiny perks.
key_stories.challenge: Inject humor and world-building into factory NPC dialogue.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed ‘benefits’ live (e.g., 5-minute lunch break, 2 coins a week instead of 1, green Koopas may turn at edges). Kaze noted each idea for later script writing.
key_stories.outcome: A comedic narrative thread to be implemented as environmental dialogue/signage in Course 11.
key_stories.key_quote: They managed to get a 5-minute break every day and Bowser pays them 2 coins a week instead of 1.

open_questions.context: Kaze said future performance gains will wait for F3DX3 implementation.
questions: What specific bottlenecks do you expect F3DX3 to solve?
Who will lead the microcode work and what is the timeline?
Could this introduce compatibility risks for real hardware?

open_questions.context: Textures and lighting are placeholders until Biobak takes over.
questions: What mood boards or real factories inspire the final look?
How will vertex-lit electricity be technically achieved on N64?
What is Biobak’s workflow for balancing grit with readability?

open_questions.topic: New Sound Set by Yoshi Milkman
open_questions.context: Kaze teased material-specific SFX but offered no demo.
questions: What is the scope of the new sound library?
How are sounds authored and compressed for N64 memory limits?
Will adaptive audio be used to reinforce gameplay feedback?

open_questions.context: Kaze repeatedly refused to name a release date due to limited hours.
questions: What realistic milestone schedule can the team commit to?
Could part-time contractors accelerate the timeline?
How will public pressure be managed as hype grows?

open_questions.context: Running-on collision bug is still unsolved; soap refill relocation planned.
questions: What technical hurdle blocks the ‘running on’ fix?
Have alternative attack phases been considered?
How will visual clarity be maintained once soap is moved to the grills?

open_questions.context: Kaze said he is ‘really looking forward’ to the Wild-West level but shared no details.
questions: What central mechanic differentiates Course 12 from earlier stages?
How will music and art direction shift to fit a Western on N64 hardware?
Any plans for a thematic boss or new power-ups?
